definition: to decide/to determine/to execute (sb)/(of a dam etc) to breach or burst/definitely/certainly

sentences.english: You"ve made a good decision, and you should stick to it."
sentences.chinese: 你们作出了好的决定，就应该坚决执行下去。

sentences.english: But Moscow has steadfastly declined to cooperate.
sentences.chinese: 但莫斯科坚决拒绝合作。

sentences.english: Over the years the company's rapid development of this principle due to the resolute performance.
sentences.chinese: 多年来公司的迅速发展得力于对这条原则的坚决执行。

sentences.english: However see him one face determined, six Shis thousand also have no not bashful fight him.
sentences.chinese: 不过看他一脸坚决，陆莳千也没好意思打击他。

sentences.english: Asana make one firm, free from maladies, and light of limb.
sentences.chinese: 瑜伽姿态使人坚决，阔别疾病并领有轻巧的身体。

sentences.english: Thereafter, the son of a father adamantly refused to re-enter the home.
sentences.chinese: 此后，父亲坚决拒绝儿子一家再进这个家门。

sentences.english: Some say it can go against you but John has a strong mental approach to football.
sentences.chinese: 有人说这会是一个劣势，但奥谢对足球决心很坚决。

sentences.english: In high school, he spurned baseball.
sentences.chinese: 在高中时期，他就坚决不打棒球。

sentences.english: Cheng bite gold face flower feet still be firm.
sentences.chinese: 程咬金面对花大脚依然态度坚决。

sentences.english: They stuck out against the motion of reducing the spendings.
sentences.chinese: 他们坚决反对削减开支的议案。

sentences.english: Thank you for your sharing. It's a very good picture.
sentences.chinese: 不错，偷拍我喜欢，谢谢楼主发片，坚决支持你。

sentences.english: He refused resolutely to pledge himself to any new thing.
sentences.chinese: 他坚决拒绝答应写任何新作品。

sentences.english: Boundaries and guidelines need to be defined explicitly and firmly for the ENP child.
sentences.chinese: 对ENP孩子，界线和规定必须定义得明确而坚决。

sentences.english: I think his determination to come for crosses is calm but commanding.
sentences.chinese: 我认为他在出击传中球上很冷静而且很坚决。

sentences.english: Insist on purchasing only those toys which have been approved as safe and lead-free.
sentences.chinese: 坚决购买那些已通过安全，无铅认证的玩具。

sentences.english: Nevertheless, Nietzsche was firmly against Scientism.
sentences.chinese: 但是，尼采坚决反对唯科学主义。

definition: to fight against/to oppose/to be opposed to/opposition
to be determined to/to insist on
determination/resolution/determined/firm and resolute/to make up one's mind/CL:個|个[ge4]
to check/to contain/to hold back/to keep within limits/to constrain/to restrain
to show one's colors/to have a clear-cut stand (idiom)
lit. to chop the nail and slice the iron (idiom)/fig. resolute and decisive/unhesitating/categorical
to strike a severe blow/to crack down/to take strong measures
to declare one's position/to say where one stands
to resist/to boycott/to refuse (to cooperate)/to reject/resistance/refusal
to take strict precautions/on your guard
